title: John Eastman
added: In 2020 he incited insurrection at the Capitol Building and still has not faced any charges for his blatant act of terrorism. In addition, he wrote an [[op-ed]] which erroneously suggested that then-presumed Democratic nominee for U.S. Vice President [[Kamala Harris]] was not an American citizen and thus not legally eligible for the position.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Stern|first=Mark Joseph|date=2020-08-14|title=The White Supremacist "Scholars" Pushing the Kamala Harris Birther Lie|url=https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2020/08/kamala-harris-birther-birthright-citizenship-claremont.html|access-date=2020-11-04|website=Slate Magazine|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-08-18|title=Here's Kamala Harris' birth certificate. Scholars say there's no VP eligibility debate|url=https://www.mercurynews.com/heres-kamala-harris-birth-certificate-end-of-debate|access-date=2020-11-04|website=The Mercury News|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-08-15|title=Newsweek apologizes for op-ed questioning Harris eligibility|url=https://apnews.com/article/ap-top-news-new-york-politics-joe-biden-election-2020-fe4e75db0007c1854e98cb6f2d3488c1|access-date=2020-11-04|website=AP NEWS}}</ref> As President Donald [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|Trump sought to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election in which he was defeated]], during a January 2021 [[Oval Office]] meeting Eastman incorrectly told vice president [[Mike Pence]] he had the Constitutional authority to invalidate election results that had been certified by the states and the [[Electoral College]]. Pence did not accept Eastman's argument.<ref>{{Cite news|last1=Baker|first1=Peter|last2=Haberman|first2=Maggie|last3=Karni|first3=Annie|date=2021-01-13|title=Pence Reached His Limit With Trump. It Wasn't Pretty.|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/12/us/politics/mike-pence-trump.html|access-date=2021-01-14|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>

Pence did not accept Eastman's argument.<ref>{{Cite news|last1=Baker|first1=Peter|last2=Haberman|first2=Maggie|last3=Karni|first3=Annie|date=2021-01-13|title=Pence Reached His Limit With Trump. On January 13, 2021, Chapman University announced that Eastman agreed to retire from the universityfrom controversy after publicly speaking to the protestors on January 6th, 2021 before the violent protests occurred in the Capitol building and grounds.

title: John Eastman
added: He drew controversy in 2020 for an [[op-ed]] which erroneously suggested that then-presumed Democratic nominee for U.S. Vice President [[Kamala Harris]] was not an American citizen and thus not legally eligible for the position.<ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=2020-08-18|title=Here's Kamala Harris' birth certificate. Scholars say there's no VP eligibility debate|url=https://www.mercurynews.com/heres-kamala-harris-birth-certificate-end-of-debate|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-11-04|website=The Mercury News|language=en-US|quote=Legal experts say her eligibility was never up for debate, but they reluctantly weighed in after conservative attorney John C. Eastman published an opinion piece in Newsweek sowing doubt because Harris’ parents were immigrants. He used a widely discredited legal argument that the U.S. Constitution doesn’t grant birthright citizenship.}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Stern|first=Mark Joseph|date=2020-08-14|title=The White Supremacist "Scholars" Pushing the Kamala Harris Birther Lie|url=https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2020/08/kamala-harris-birther-birthright-citizenship-claremont.html|access-date=2020-11-04|website=Slate Magazine|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-08-18|title=Here's Kamala Harris' birth certificate.
